title: Part a. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

The force due to the magnetic field provides the centripetal force that causes the ion to move in a semicircle.

F = qv x B, so by the right-hand rule the magnetic field must point into the page (or in the –z direction).

1 point: For field being perpendicular to the page

1 point: For direction into the page orin the –z direction
descriptions:
No points earned

1 point: For field being perpendicular to the page

1 point: For direction into the page orin the –z direction

Earns 1 of 2 points

title: Part b. [0–1]
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Between the plates, the electric field must exert a force opposite to that of the magnetic field.

The magnetic force is to the right, and Felec – qE, so the electric field should point toward the left.

1 point: Therefore, plate K should have a positive polarity with respect to plate L.
descriptions:
No point earned

The magnetic force is to the right, and Felec – qE, so the electric field should point toward the left.

1 point: Therefore, plate K should have a positive polarity with respect to plate L.

Earns 1 of 1 point

title: Part c. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

Using the relation between the electric field and potential difference for parallel plates:

1 point: E = V/d

Substituting:

E = (1500 V) / (0.012 m)

1 point: E = 1.25 x 105 V/m
descriptions:
No points earned

title: Part d. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points

1 point: For a particle to pass between the plates undeflected, the forces due to the electric and magnetic fields FE and FB respectively must be equal in magnitude and in opposite directions

1 point: FE = qE

1 point: FB = qvB

Therefore, qE = qvB

1 point: Solving for v:

v = E/B = (1.25 x 105 V/m) / (0.20 T)
v = 6.25 x 105 m/s
descriptions:
No points earned

Therefore, qE = qvB

1 point: Solving for v:

v = E/B = (1.25 x 105 V/m) / (0.20 T)
v = 6.25 x 105 m/s

title: Part e. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: The centripetal force Fc is equal to the force qvB due to the magnetic field.

1 point: F c = m v 2 R

m v 2 R = q v B

Solving for m:

m=qBR/v

Substituting:
m = (1.6 x 10–19 C) (0.20 T) (0.50 m) / (6.25 x 105 m/s)
1 point: m = 2.56 x 10–26 kg
descriptions:

title: Part f [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

1 point: Substituting 2q into the force equation from part e. and solving for the new radius R' :
R ' = m v 2 q B

Substituting the expression for m from part e:

R ' = m v 2 q B         q B R v = R / 2

R' = 0.25 m
descriptions:
Earns 0 of 2 points

title: Unit point [0–1]
stimulusHtml: 1 point: Additional 1 point awarded if all units are correct
